scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion M. Noble was born in Arkansas and grew up in dire poverty. As an outgrowth of political consciousness acquired at Commonwealth College (Mena, Arkansas), he became a volunteer in the Spanish Civil War and served in the Abraham Lincoln Brigade. The collection consists of a copy of a typescript autobiography covering the period from his childhood through his return from Spain to New York City in December 1938, as well as his father's life as a railroad laborer and tales of Arkansas life.
